title: Step 1
desc:
From android 11 and above substratum cant make changes to layout. So it wont work like the way it used to be on android 10!

You have to request a custom magisk module from the developer for this theme to work! all thanks to google. This module will help you change lockscreen clocks using madness substratum theme.
desc1:
So make sure you request module before doing anything!
Without module this theme wont work so please request module before using it.

title: Step 2
desc:
Once you get the module from dev, You can flash it via Magisk

I repeat, its a magisk module so please flash it via magisk
desc1: After flashing you can either reboot or proceed to the next step

title: Step 3
desc: Now you need to pick lockscreen clock you want use, For that you need to open madness from substratum app and select a clock from -- PICK YOUR CLOCK -- option
desc1: You can also view clock previews within this app. This will help you identify the clocks you like and will help you pick colors for them

title: Step 4
desc:
After you select a clock, You need to pick colors for them

There are 3 attributes available for you to pick.
desc1: You need to listen very carefully here! these 3 attribute decide the colors of the clock you select.You can completely ignore the naming of these 3 attributes on some clock this has nothing to do with background color , text color or outline color. All you should focus on which attributes theme which part of the clock Thats why clock previews exists!
desc2: This is an example from clock preview, As you can see there are three attributes which is available on the theming section of madness! BACKGROUND COLOR,TEXT COLOR,OUTLINE COLOR FOR EXAMPLE BACKGROUND COLOR - Date( Day month date) Means If you pick red as background color, The Date will be in red color. TEXT COLOR - Time Means If you pick green as TEXT COLOR. The time will be in green color. OUTLINE COLOR - Lock icon Means if you pick Yellow as OUTLINE COLOR. The Lock icon will be in yellow color
desc3:
So different clocks have different components, But all are linked to these three attributes which i explained above, This is done on purpose to give the user maximum available freedom for coloring clocks.
Once you start changing colors of clocks you will get the hang of it!
